result.execSummary:
The defendant Tania Noel Poniewaz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for zero days time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.

miscConds.notes:
no contact with any walmart
no new violations of the law, no new retail theft tickets
attend the UWM retail theft program
pay $200.00 fine including all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges forthwith or 10 days in the House of Correction, due to low income

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tania Noel Poniewaz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tania Noel Poniewaz in court with attorney Paul J. Manley.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for zero days time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for one year with the following conditions:
*no contact with any walmart
*pay $200.00 fine including all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges forthwith or 10 days in the House of Correction, due to low income
*no new violations of the law, no new retail theft tickets
*attend the UWM retail theft program

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Tania Noel Poniewaz in court with attorney Paul J. Manley.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-23-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 03-11-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Tania Noel Poniewaz
Current: S62W23187 Fern Drive, Waukesh, WI 53189   (Effective: 02-18-2015)
Prior: 6230 South Pennsylvania Avenue, Cudahy, WI 53110
On Motion from the State, Court amended the date in the last paragraph from 2014 to 2015

Defendant Tania Noel Poniewaz in court.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.47  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 2/18/15 @ 1 PM
